page.title: 20Evergreen Club,Longtown.
page.content: The Evergreen Club in Longtown was formed to foster social activities for the Over 60's.It currently has a membership of over 50,some are over 80yrs of age.It is run by a committee of ten elected members together with a secretary and treasurer.It holds meetings once a week in the Longtown Clinic,charging 15p for admission.The Parish Council helps with the cost of the rental of the premises.A varied programme is arranged by the committee .There is a Bingo session once a month,A Sale of Work twice a year. Excursions are planned to Dumfries & Kirkcudbright, Morcambe,and Blackpool in October.There is always a Christmas Party held each year.Members over 80 receive a gift of a 1/2lb of Tea.Sick members receive a card or flowers. Visiting speakers address members from time to time.The future seems secure.
